amendatorysection.catchline: Failure to file own risk and solvency assessment summary report; penalty.
amendatorysection.para: Any insurer failing, without just cause, to timely file its own risk and solvency assessment summary report as required in the Risk Management and Own Risk and Solvency Assessment Act shall be required, after notice and hearing, to pay a penalty of not to exceed two hundred dollars for each day's delay. The maximum penalty under this section is ten thousand dollars. The director may reduce the penalty if the insurer demonstrates to the director that the imposition of the penalty would constitute a financial hardship to the insurer. The director shall remit any penalties collected under this section to the State Treasurer for distribution in accordance with Article VII, section 5, of the Constitution of Nebraska.
